Here we establish a different approach by depositing a monosheet of BiI 3 on the (0001) surface of the topological insulator (TI) Bi 2Se 3 by using molecular beam epitaxy (MBE) from a Knudsen cell filled with presynthesized BiTeI single crystals heated to 380 °C. As a result, a stoichiometrically almost exact BiI 3 film is deposited by decomposition sublimation of BiTeI, as corroborated by X-ray photoemission spectroscopy (XPS), scanning tunnelling microscopy (STM) and surface X-ray diffraction (SXRD). In addition, momentum resolved photoemission spectroscopy
6 demonstrates the instability of the Dirac topological surface state (TSS) of the Bi 2Se 3 substrate upon BiI 3 deposition and the appearance of flat band interface states in the direct band gap of BiI 3.
